title: Mrbluntzy
author: Mrbluntzy
content: Some guys in the area are saying that Trump is the reason why Bitcoin got to $100k last year and even surpassed it this year. Do anyone of you here have same thought? In my opinion, wiithout the US presidential election, Bitcoin would have still surge to $100k last year or this year. There's no reason to give unnecessary credit to Trump as the god that made it possible for Bitcoin to quickly catapulted to $100k. Do you agree with those people that are giving credit to Trump? What do you have to say.

comments.author: Ziskinberg
comments.body: I’d agree with that.... but... he was also a big reason why Bitcoin dropped below $80K because of the high tariffs he announced. Or maybe, during the election season and everyone’s watching, he used it to hype things up and even slipped in his Trump Coin because he knew people would buy it. And then what happened next? It dumped. So , don’t trust Trump too much. He always has some hidden agenda behind his actions.

comments.author: WeedGoW
comments.body: I can’t say correctly what people think because I know that the multiple factors behind the price of bitcoins work, only one by one does not go upward. Maybe Donald Trump supports Bitcoin for reasons that the price of bitcoin and the overnight increase will be foolish. Bitcoin’s price usually rises on supply demand and its price may also be upward under the influence of various varied events such as the global epidemic or ruling decisions of different countries. When the epidemic began around the world, people’s trust in crypto currency was created as people began to trust cryptocurrencies during the coronavirus. The comments you made seem reasonable to me but there are many reasons for the increase in bitcoin price to accept it.

comments.body: In my opinion Bitcoin helped himBitcoin could have crossed the $100K mark without his helpThough he did help in hastening the process.Credit for what? Price manipulation? Shitcoin creation for daylight extortion? Glorifying shitcoins for his own agenda? Tariff War? I'm curious which credit they are talking about

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.created_time: March 09, 2025, 07:12:39 AMLast edit: March 09, 2025, 02:12:55 PM by Oshosondy
comments.body: You should remember that Trump used it as a means to have crypto supporters.Satoshi is the main reason bitcoin got to $100000 because he made it a deflationary currency. Bitcoin developers also are part of it because they do not want to a deflationary currency. Also bitcoin community are part of it because they buy bitcoin. Trump is also part of it but all those that I have mentioned are important than just only Trump because if Trump did not do it, bitcoin will still get to $100000 but it might not be faster as it was.

comments.author: MinoRaiola
comments.body: Quote from: Mrbluntzy on March 09, 2025, 06:24:23 AMSome guys in the area are saying that Trump is the reason why Bitcoin got to $100k last year and even surpassed it this year.Donald Trump has also driven up the price, but he wasnt the only one to do so. Since the speech in Nashville and the Bitcoin reserve, there has been a positive push in the price. But you shouldnt forget the halving, which also have played a part in the price going over 100k. The cycle after the halving has always been good in the past, and the period after the elections in America was also good. So Trump is one who has participated in a time that is positive for bitcoin. But bitcoin does not need presidents in the long term, but in the short term it is a faster increase in the price.

comments.author: TheUltraElite
comments.body: A lot of reasons could be behind that 100k race. At present though at 85k I see a stagnancy in price, I hope this changes and we can go back to 100k and then grow from there.With the strategic reserve idea going around, a bullish movement will be coming in. If the US does this, more countries are going to follow suit and that should make the governments there more lenient towards exchanges and users.However we are still in the dark about what Trump actually wants. So collect bitcoins before they run out!

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: When a public figure like a presidential candidate talks about Bitcoin in positive (or negative) way, specially a loudmouth like Trump, and most importantly when it is largely covered by the mainstream media it obviously has its effect on the bitcoin market.But from what we know of the market, that effect was not as big as some people have been trying to make it to be.Before his campaign for votes where he namedropped bitcoin, the price was already up from $40k bottom and was re-testing $70k resistance. At best that namedropping helped break that resistance. But the rest is normal market behavior after such a resistance is broken (price shoots up a lot higher breaking more resistances easier). See 2023 for example to see similar event. In the last quarter of 2023 price is stuck behind the $50k resistance and when it is finally broken the price keeps on breaking more levels and reaches $70k in about 3 months.We had the same in last quarter of 2024, after being stuck behind $70k wall it was broken and then price reached $110k in about 3 months!

comments.author: InvoKing
comments.body: Bitcoin and cryptocurrency in general are very volatile and since we still look at it as they were pegged to dollar and other FIAT then their price will depend from everything related to finance and politics.

If you blame Trump like many others but deny his contribution to the rise in bitcoin prices late last year, it's ridiculous.

comments.author: freedomgo
comments.body: The numbers don’t lie.Price before Trump won – below $70K.After Trump won – over $100K.That’s a massive jump, and there wasn’t any major news at the time that could explain why Bitcoin’s price surged. It all points to Trump’s victory. He made promises to the Bitcoin community, including Bitcoin-friendly policies and even the possibility of making it a national reserve. So that resulted to bullish speculation.

comments.author: HeRetiK
comments.body: Quote from: freedomgo on March 09, 2025, 09:57:59 AMThe numbers don’t lie.Price before Trump won – below $70K.After Trump won – over $100K.That’s a massive jump, and there wasn’t any major news at the time that could explain why Bitcoin’s price surged. It all points to Trump’s victory. He made promises to the Bitcoin community, including Bitcoin-friendly policies and even the possibility of making it a national reserve. So that resulted to bullish speculation. Correlation does not imply causation.Also that's not a "massive jump". That's Bitcoin on a good weekend. Four years ago, in that very same timeframe from Biden's win in November 2020 to March 2021, Bitcoin saw a surge from less than $15k to $50k. That there is solid growth. I'm not ascribing the tripling of Bitcoin's value to Biden, mind you. I'm just saying that Bitcoin went from zero to $70k without the politician simping we see these days. Breaking through $100k took merely another less than 50% on top of the orders of magnitude growth we saw before that. Don't let politicians tell you what to think.
